name: unreviewed
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If something is unreviewed, it is not considered again in order to make changes to it or to give a new opinion on it: Properties had been allowed to run down, and rents had gone unreviewed. The initial test result sat unreviewed by city officials for about two years. See also
review verb (THINK AGAIN)
unreviewable
If a book, film, etc. is unreviewed, it has no reviews (= reports giving an opinion about it): Books in the field are mostly unreviewed and its discoveries are unreported. See also
review
More examplesFewer examplesOur criminal justice system gives too much unreviewed power to prosecutors.A backlog of at least 10,000 applications sits unreviewed in the district's human resources system. Such research is invariably unreviewed and unscientific.She spent six years in barely seen and unreviewed stage roles.
